div.h1: Accessibility statement for Sumner County Schools
div.p: We want everyone who visits the Sumner County Schools website to feel welcome and find the experience rewarding.

To help us make the Sumner County Schools website a positive place for everyone, we've been using the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0. These guidelines explain how to make web content more accessible for people with disabilities, and user friendly for everyone.
The guidelines have three levels of accessibility (A, AA and AAA). We’ve chosen Level AA as the target for the Sumner County Schools website.

We've worked hard on the Sumner County Schools website and believe we've achieved our goal of Level AA accessibility. We monitor the website regularly to maintain this, but if you do find any problems, please get in touch.
div.h2: Let us know what you think
div.p: If you enjoyed using the Sumner County Schools website, or if you had trouble with any part of it, please get in touch. We'd like to hear from you in any of the following ways:

div.h1: A Rich History in Sumner County
div.p: Sumner County Schools has been in operation since 1873. Our district currently has 49 schools in operation including 1 Middle College High School, 1 Middle Technical College High School, 7 regular high schools, 1 virtual high school, 11 middle schools, 24 elementary schools, 2 STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) elementary schools, 1 academic magnet school and 1 alternative/zero tolerance school.
Sumner County Schools commits to growing learners who are college and career ready through quality instruction, effective use of resources, building a collaborative culture, and strong leadership.
